I wanted to point out that the `prefer-named-capture-group` rule suggest that 2 actions that can be made to fix the error:
- either convert the group to a non-capturing group
- or use a named group

![rule](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22861194/131539606-ddff983f-02a5-406d-ba3a-9b04d5dc75e8.png)

However, the [current version of documentation](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/blob/b301069981dc1dcca51df2813dcebdca8c150502/docs/rules/prefer-named-capture-group.md) only explains how to use the named groups. 

While I understand that the rule tries to enforce _named_ groups, it would be wise to instruct about the usage of non-capturing groups `(?:)`. Somebody already must have noticed that case when they created the error message, so why not explaining the second approach further in the docs?
